attributes.action: Commission a public competition for a new London 2012 logo
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The new 2012 logo looks like it was scrawled on the wall of a shop at some time in 1982. Not the symbol of the world's biggest sporting event being held in one of the world's great cities.

C'mon - we can do better than that.

If the government is paying for the games, can we not spend money on an open competition for the public - to aid "participation, stimulation, access, and inspiration", the alleged "brand pillars" of the games.

Then a vote on the winner from a shortlist.

Is that so much to ask?

For the public to have a say in the key symbol of an event that will be publicly funded, representing London and the UK to the rest of the world, and that we will be stuck with for the next five years at least?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
